sentences.english: If you must do something else, have some tea.
sentences.chinese: 如必須做點雜事，且靜品茶一杯。

sentences.english: He is a magnificent teacher who helps us grasp complex matters with ease.
sentences.chinese: 祂是教導我們輕易地理解複雜事物的偉大老師。

sentences.english: Human language is typically complexed and should be studied with the complexity method.
sentences.chinese: 語言本身是複雜事物，必須用複雜性方法來研究。

sentences.english: As complex as things are today, everything will be more complex tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 如同今天的複雜事物，明天的一切將會變得更加複雜。

sentences.english: She wants employees to share the chore of leading tours of the office each week.
sentences.chinese: 她希望員工每星期分擔辦公室重要巡視的雜事。

sentences.english: I was just taking care of bills etm. before he came over.
sentences.chinese: 他來之前我才正在整理賬單等雜事。

sentences.english: After doing dishes or kitchen chores, I use Almond Milk.
sentences.chinese: 在洗過碗和做過廚房雜事之後，我用杏仁牛奶護手霜。

sentences.english: You don't have to chase after those grand and complicating things.
sentences.chinese: 你無需追尋那些華而不實的複雜事物。

sentences.english: His talent smothered in his trifles.
sentences.chinese: 瑣碎雜事扼殺了他的才能。

definition: to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to bribe/to get (luggage) ready/to put in order/to organize things/(baseball) RBI (run batted in)
things like this (idiom); and so on/and the rest/etc
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
